arts.ttl: World Cup winner Olivier Giroud victim of reported $500,000 burglary in LA
arts.sum: LAFC striker was not at home during break-in Athletes in US have been targeted by burglars Los Angeles FC striker Olivier Giroud’s home was the target of a burglary earlier this month, police said. Los Angeles police said they responded on 5 February to a report that a window had been smashed at a home in west LA. Giroud and his family were not home when the incident occurred. Burglars entered the residence through the window, and when Giroud’s wife came home to find items – including 10 luxury watches – missing, she called police, according to reports by ESPN and TMZ Sports. The burglars are reported to have taken valuables worth $500,000 during the break-in. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Thieves steal $500k worth of jewelry from French soccer star Olivier Giroud’s LA home
arts.sum: The break-in was discovered on February 5 by the striker’s wife, who found a smashed window on their property, and called the LAPD

arts.ttl: Olivier Giroud’s Los Angeles home burgled for nearly €500,000-worth of property
arts.sum: According to US-based outlet TMZ Sports, relayed by L’Équipe Former France striker Olivier Giroud’s Los Angeles home was reportedly broken into earlier this month. Whilst the 2018 World Cup winner and his…

arts.ttl: Ex-Arsenal and Chelsea star Olivier Giroud victim of burglary as £400k goods stolen
arts.sum: Former Premier League star Olivier Giroud has been the victim of a burglary after thieves broke into his Los Angeles home and stole items worth an estimate £400,000
